sourceDesc.p: This publication constitutes a remediation of the printed Inns of Court collection. Information on original sources for transcriptions can be accessed via the Document Descriptions.
For a full list of REED collections, editors, executive board members, and staff, please visit http://reed.utoronto.ca/people

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the taxon prefix are pointers to entities in the taxonomy.xml file. For example, taxon:church dereferences to taxonomy.xml#church.
Private URIs using the gloss prefix are pointers to entities in the glossary.xml file. For example, gloss:histrio-1 dereferences to glossary.xml#histrio-1.

projectDesc.p: Records of Early English Drama (REED) is an international scholarly project that is establishing for the first time the context from which the drama of Shakespeare and his contemporaries grew. Founded in 1976, REED has worked since then to locate, transcribe, and edit historical documents containing evidence of drama, secular music, and other communal entertainment and ceremony from the Middle Ages until 1642, when the Puritans closed the London theatres.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Most Inner Temple parliament acts were recorded in a series of Parliament Books. Occasionally, however, acts strayed into other documents, such as the act of 23 December 1624 (see p 213) concerning expenses at Christmas, which survives only in the Christmas Account Book for that year. Damaged by fire the three earliest Parliament Books are partly carbonized along all three outside edges, with the result that some lines of text and even whole entries are now illegible. Repaired and rebound c 1960 the volumes remain brittle and difficult to open (especially the first volume in the series). The standard essential publication is F.A. Inderwick (ed), A Calendar of the Inner Temple Records, 2 vols (London, 1896, 1898). Lost text can sometimes be supplied from Inderwick.
mods:mods.mods:accessCondition: Use of this public-domain resource is governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

revisionDesc.change: split single file with multiple records into separate files, one record per file

div.head: f 229 (23 November 1634)
div.ab: fforasmuchOrder for Master Treasurer to disburse 170 li. towardes ye Masque as it appeared this present parliament, by the relacion of Mr Willys one of the Benchers of this Howse whoe hath beene employed and trusted in the disbursinge of diuers sommes of money towardes the Masque which was presented before his Maiestie that over and besides such summes of money as haue beene delivered vnto him by the Cheife butler of this Howse which hee collected vppon the saide Rolle and such other monyes as hee the said Mr Willys hath held had from the late Treasurer of this Howse out of the howse stock hee hath occasion for ye expendinge of one hundred and seaventy poundes more for the cleere and absolute defrayinge of all charges of the said Masque soe farre forth as concerneth this howse, It is therefore ordered that Master Treasurer shall deliver vnto the said Mr Willys out of the Stock of the Howse the said somme of 170 li. and this present act shalbe a sufficient warrant & discharge to the said Master Treasurer for ye deliuery thereof hee takinge a receipt from the said Mr Willys for ye same./.

It Refered vnto the Committees for ye masque for re rewardesis referred to the Committees for ye Masque to consider whatt rewardes are fitt to be bestowed on Sir Richard Sheltons and Mr Willys men for their paines about the masque busines that Mr Willys his accompt may be finished, And the Committees are desired to make their Report the first parliament of the next Terme touchinge the said Rewardes, and his Accomptes./

div.head: f 229v (25 January 1634/5)
div.ab: AccordingeMr Willis discharged of all accomptes touchinge ye masque to an order of the last parliament the Committees for the Masque did now make their Report and produced the Accompt which they had taken of Mr Willys Treasurer for ye Masque whereby it appeared that ye disbursementes of ye said Mr Willys doe equall his receiptes. It is therefore ordered that the said Mr Willys be absolutely freed and discharged of all further accomptes touchinge the same. And this Society doth acknowledge his greate care and paines in the faithfull performance of that trust./

div.head: f 230v (8 February 1634/5)

ab.hi: Order to repay the Riders at ye Masque

div.ab: It is at this parliament thought fitt & Ordered That Master Treasurer shall deliuer unto Mr Pope, and Mr ffinche and such other of the fellowes of this Society (whoe after they had paid vppon the Aide Rolle for ye Masque were riders at ye solempnity) such sommes of money as they paid vppon the said Rolle or for hire of Saddles which have not already beene repaid vnto them./
